channel.title: Think twice about using Uppit.com
channel.description:
[b]Think twice about using Uppit.com[/b]
Earlier this week while downloading, I've noticed some weird stuff going on. A virus/multiple virusses where downloading from Uppit.com or a connected site.
Please take a look at this report! [url=http://www.siteadvisor.com/sites/uppit.com]http://www.siteadvisor.com/sites/uppit.com[/url]
Thanks.
EDIT: For the people who can't load the site: [img]http://i28.tinypic.com/9aa5iq.png[/img] [img]http://i26.tinypic.com/rc4so7.png[/img] [img]http://i30.tinypic.com/20rabya.png[/img]

item.title: Think twice about using Uppit.com
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“1500, post:13, topic:349387”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=445758.msg3272134#msg3272134 date=1279292656]

It is not Uppit that puts a virus into the file you’r downloading, It is people that put viruses in it…

I think some uploading sites prevent you from uploading a virus… But Uppit allows it!

Uppit.com IS the guilty one! Uppit.com puts virusses in their own website, not in the files that people upload.

‘‘Tried to download a virus to my computer without permission when I wasn’t even downloading anything but avast stopped it. Who knows what else this site will do… DON’T GO!’’
That’s what a person said on the siteadvisor site.

Just a warning for everybody who might download something from Uppit.

The person who said that is an IDIOT!!! Websites can’t ‘download a virus to your computer without your asking’, it’s not possible, unless you already have another virus that is initiating the download.

Uppit is safe to use, but no matter what site you use you have to always be careful about what you download. Always scan your downloads with a good virus scanner before you run them, and most importantly use common sense, don’t run a server.exe when you expect a server written in java etc etc.
[/quote]

Try visiting hxxp://tigerden.uppit.com with NOD32 fully updated. (make hxxp to http)

2ai0c9j.png871×445

The warning I get:

http://www.malwaredomainlist.com/mdl.php?search=uppit.com&colsearch=All&quantity=50
Hmm… I’m confused. Can anybody explain this?[/quote]

Potentially dangerous, it looks like they just blacklisted the whole of uppit because a small minority of user-created files contain viruses.

Read full topic

item.title: Think twice about using Uppit.com
item.description:
@1500 wrote:

rain1994:

I think it is the person who is using uppit to decide wether or not to download. before you extract there is a button to scanit with winrar

I am not talking about the files that get uploaded, I’m talking about Uppit itself.

Read full topic

Uppit is safe to use, but no matter what site you use you have to always be careful about what you download. item.title: Think twice about using Uppit.com
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“1500, post:10, topic:349387”][quote author=spy man47 link=topic=445758.msg3272054#msg3272054 date=1279283196]
It is not Uppit that puts a virus into the file you’r downloading, It is people that put viruses in it…

I think some uploading sites prevent you from uploading a virus… But Uppit allows it!
[/quote]

Uppit.com IS the guilty one! Uppit.com puts virusses in their own website, not in the files that people upload.

‘‘Tried to download a virus to my computer without permission when I wasn’t even downloading anything but avast stopped it. Who knows what else this site will do… DON’T GO!’’
That’s what a person said on the siteadvisor site.

Just a warning for everybody who might download something from Uppit.[/quote]

The person who said that is an IDIOT!!! Websites can’t ‘download a virus to your computer without your asking’, it’s not possible, unless you already have another virus that is initiating the download.

Uppit is safe to use, but no matter what site you use you have to always be careful about what you download. Always scan your downloads with a good virus scanner before you run them, and most importantly use common sense, don’t run a server.exe when you expect a server written in java etc etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Think twice about using Uppit.com
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Do you actually have any proof of this site other than “Tried to download a virus to my computer without permission when I wasn’t even downloading anything but avast stopped it. Who knows what else this site will do… DON’T GO!”? That could have easily been something else… I’ve been using Uppit for a long time with not one bit of protection on my computer and haven’t gotten anything. I think this “SiteAdvisor” is full of shit.

Read full topic

I think some uploading sites prevent you from uploading a virus… But Uppit allows it![/quote]None has that? it would have to run a scan on the file; 5000 scans at one time = EPIC LAGG / CRASH / DoS

item.title: Think twice about using Uppit.com

item.title: Think twice about using Uppit.com
item.description:
@1500 wrote:

[quote=“Mitko, post:6, topic:349387”]Thanks to that tool i found this:
http://runescape.com/rsimages.zip

There’s no date on them but they look like they’re really old from back in the days.[/quote]

Ehh?

[quote="`Aaron, post:4, topic:349387"]I think everyone will continue to use it at their OWN risk.

Theres no sense preaching about it here.[/quote]

Noted.

Lin:

Uppit giving out viruses has nothing to do with Uppit or its owners. Note that people CAN upload any files they want, which could include viruses.

The uploaded files can contain virusses, but in this case Uppit.com is the one who downloads the virusses. My NOD32 said that a part of Uppit.com (not the file I was trying to download) was downloading a virus.

Read full topic
